posts.post_content:
The day I stopped using this card:  
  
Turn 1: Island, Sol Ring, [Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter)  
Turn 2: Island, [Higure, the Still Wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Higure, the Still Wind), Ornithopter again  
  
What followed was a short one-sided game that wasn't fun for either of us. To this day I only put Sol Ring in a deck if it's *fantastically* underpowered.
posts.html:
The day I stopped using this card:

Turn 1: Island, Sol Ring, Ornithopter
Turn 2: Island, Higure, the Still Wind, Ornithopter again

What followed was a short one-sided game that wasn't fun for either of us. To this day I only put Sol Ring in a deck if it's fantastically underpowered.

posts.post_content: This card is just downright dumb. You get the mana acceleration of an off-color mox on the turn you play it, then get double that each turn after that. I particularly hate cards like these because they are so boring. Its one thing when you get an Over Powered card like Necropotence when you can just sit there like 0.o at it for 5 minutes. This? Its just dumb.

I really agree with a lot of the comments saying, "Should not have being put in PreCons."
